newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Shinhwa sets '97 sales at 180 bln won.
newsitem.headline: Shinhwa sets '97 sales at 180 bln won.

text.p: South Korea's Shinhwa Co Ltd, a telecommunications equipment producer, said on Friday its sales would reach 180 billion won this year from 35 billion, helped by the development of a communications and tracking device for vehicles.

A Shinhwa official said the company would begin marketing in late March the Tacho Global Positioning System (TGPS), which it developed over the past three years. The system allows control centres to track and communicate with vehicles.
"We have already received 75,000 orders from bus, taxi and shipping companies," the official said.
The unit price was set at around two million won.
